group_1.textLeft: Kyaha★
Like, there were really like so many stores, right?@It was totally fun!

group_1.textRight: Yeah... I guess it's good that we had time to@walk around the town.
We didn't come here for sightseeing, you know...

group_1.textLeft: There's something I'm more worried about...
Where did I, where did I...
Where in the world did I drop my phone...?

group_1.textRight: When was the last time you used it...?

group_1.textLeft: This morning, I think.
Earlier, I was going to take a commemorative@photo in town,
when I realized I didn't have it with me...

group_1.textRight: To begin with, the very act of bringing your phone@into an era when there is no radio reception
is already awkward. And to try to take a souvenir@photo, and even more so, to lose it...
That's a highly problematic mindset for a@time traveler...

group_1.textLeft: If Time Patrol were out there, would they arrest@me on the spot...?

group_1.textRight: It's not a matter of arrest. Modern smartphones@are objects that aren't supposed to exist in this era.
They are out-of-place artifacts—@OOPArt, so to speak.
If such an item is discovered 2000 years later in@an archaeological site, it could cause a big fuss
in the modern age.@Or, in the worst case scenario...
...someone in Pompeii may have already@picked it up by now.

group_1.textLeft: Oh right, Shigurin.
Watch out so you don't drop your big@headphones too, 'kay?

group_1.textRight: ...Ugh... Okay...
Oh, you're back, Himena, Miyurin and Shigurin.

group_1.textLeft: How was your stroll through the city?

group_1.textRight: Thankies★
The town was seriously lively.@We had like a crazy good time!

group_1.textLeft: I'm glad to hear.
Lady Miyurin, you look a little downcast.

group_1.textRight: Uhh, umm... Actually, I dropped my phone...

group_1.textLeft: Your..."phone"?

group_1.textRight: It's a thin, square machine that you can@hold in your palm...

group_1.textLeft: Do you mean something like that little writing@board we saw earlier...
...that shows you pictures and sounds@when you touch it?

group_1.textRight: Writing board... Also known as a tabula, from which@"tablet" is derived.
That's it, that's it!@Where did you see it?!

group_1.textLeft: We found it in the spare room where we@store our things.
If I recall correctly, the room we used for our@meeting with Miyurin and the others this morning.

group_1.textRight: Oh... I must have left it there then!
If I had dropped it in town,
it would have turned into a new time@paradox incident...
We've only dodged the worst of the worst.@As it stands, we're still on thin ice...
So then, so then, where is my phone now?

group_1.textLeft: In the spare room we found it in.
Since it was mixed in with Father's curios,
I figured we probably shouldn't take it out@without permission.
So I thought, but it was actually your possession@all along.
At any rate, let's head to the room in question!
...Huh? I don't see it.
But I was sure I left it in the basket in the@corner of the room...

group_1.textRight: The basket itself is gone... Perhaps one of the@handmaidens put it away.

group_1.textLeft: Maybe your father took it.
Isn't that bad...?

group_1.textRight: Quite. From the way these two were talking@about it earlier...
Not only was the device powered on,@but the apps were also working.

group_1.textLeft: Don't ya like usually use a screen lock or something?

group_1.textRight: I didn't want my phone to lock itself when my@games are farming in Auto-mode, so...

group_1.textLeft: You're such a hardcore gamer...?

group_1.textRight: By the way, which app did you guys see?
Since there's no Internet connection here,
I guess many apps there didn't work, buuut...

group_1.textLeft: Well, it's hard to explain...
We saw pictures with a lot of beauteous legs.
Every time you touched the tabula with your hand,@it changed to another picture.

group_1.textRight: Aaahhh, th-th-th-...THOSE!!!@Those are e-versions of self-published doujinshi...!
Not that digital media distinguishes between@"self-published" and "shelf-published"...

group_1.textLeft: Hey... Isn't this like seriously super, super bad?
I mean, it's good and all if only you two saw it,
but we don't even know who has it right now,@am I right?

group_1.textRight: Precisely.
I know you're feeling quite numb to it, but it's a@matter that warrants some grave reflection
by the time it's been seen by Cornelia and Amaryllis...@If it gets passed into someone else's hands,
an unforeseen time paradox may be triggered.

group_1.textLeft: But us cuties are like already messing@with history, no?

group_1.textRight: Yes, to restore it to the right course.
Still,
to allow the ancient Romans to touch an actual@smartphone, a piece of cutting-edge technology,
can hardly be considered proper history@however you look at it.

group_1.textLeft: A-A new crisis has appeared all because of Miyu...

group_1.textRight: ...Perhaps I was a little too threatening.@I apologize.
Since we arrived in this era, I myself have@incurred a number of errors as well...
I only meant that it has the "potential" to@create a crisis.
...I'll ask the handmaidens as to who took it away.

group_1.textLeft: M-me too...!
